channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration seeks to roll back protections for imperiled species and habitat
item.description: The Interior Department proposed reviving a suite of changes to Endangered Species Act regulations first made during the Republican's first term. Those changes were reversed under former President Biden.
item.content:encoded:
The Interior Department proposed reviving a suite of changes to Endangered Species Act regulations first made during the Republican's first term. Those changes were reversed under former President Biden.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: House lawmakers force a vote on bill to restore federal workers' bargaining rights
item.description: House lawmakers have collected enough signatures to force a vote on a bill that would nullify President Trump's executive order terminating collective bargaining rights for most federal workers.
item.content:encoded: House lawmakers have collected enough signatures to force a vote on a bill that would nullify President Trump's executive order terminating collective bargaining rights for most federal workers.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Curaçao to Cape Verde: Small nations make big World Cup history
item.description: From tiny Curaçao, to troubled Haiti's remarkable comeback, discover how some of the smallest nations in the world are defying the odds to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
item.content:encoded:
From tiny Curaçao, to troubled Haiti's remarkable comeback, discover how some of the smallest nations in the world are defying the odds to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

(Image credit: ANGEL BATTA)
item.dc:creator: Alfie Pannell

item.title: A fire in southwestern Japan damages 170 homes and forces evacuations
item.description: Firefighters and army helicopters battled a fire that burned through old wooden houses in a fishing town in southwestern Japan.
item.content:encoded:
Firefighters and army helicopters battled a fire that burned through old wooden houses in a fishing town in southwestern Japan.

(Image credit: Kyodo News)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How Kash Patel is roiling the FBI and changing its mission
item.description: New Yorker writer Marc Fisher says Patel became FBI director without senior law enforcement experience because of his loyalty to Trump and willingness to seek retribution for his perceived enemies.
item.content:encoded: New Yorker writer Marc Fisher says Patel became FBI director without senior law enforcement experience because of his loyalty to Trump and willingness to seek retribution for his perceived enemies.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Greetings from Yimianpo, China, where artisans carve Russian nesting dolls
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: As a labor force, artists are 'invisible.' A new survey tries to change that
item.description: 'Struggling artists' isn't a trope, according to a new report. The survey asked more than 2,600 artists about everything from hours worked to housing.
item.content:encoded:
'Struggling artists' isn't a trope, according to a new report. The survey asked more than 2,600 artists about everything from hours worked to housing.

(Image credit: Clark Scott)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: World Toilet Day is today! Um ... is that really the best name?
item.description: Nov. 19 is World Toilet Day — officially declared by the United Nations to bring attention to the 3.4 billion people who live without "safely managed sanitation."
item.content:encoded:
Nov. 19 is World Toilet Day — officially declared by the United Nations to bring attention to the 3.4 billion people who live without "safely managed sanitation."

(Image credit: Aly Hazzaa)
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: Dems may have an advantage in the 2026 midterms. And, Trump defends Saudi crown prince
item.description: President Trump defends Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman during a White House visit. And, a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll reveals the president's low approval rating.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump defends Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman during a White House visit. And, a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll reveals the president's low approval rating.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Student escapes as authorities search for 24 other girls abducted in Nigeria
item.description: A schoolgirl who was abducted with 24 others from a dormitory in northwestern Nigeria has escaped and is safe, as hunters joined security forces in the search for the missing students.
item.content:encoded:
A schoolgirl who was abducted with 24 others from a dormitory in northwestern Nigeria has escaped and is safe, as hunters joined security forces in the search for the missing students.

(Image credit: Tunde Omolehin)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
